Fidelity Investments.notes: Specific support varies between account types

Facebook.notes: Hardware 2FA requires also enabling a back-up method and is unsupported on mobile.

Quickbooks Online.notes: TOTP 2FA only available after enabling SMS or phone 2FA.

OneDrive.notes: 2FA phone calls may not be available in all regions

Outlook.com.notes: 2FA phone calls may not be available in all regions

Evernote.notes: SMS and phone call are always enabled as backup methods for TOTP.

Enjin.notes: 2FA is only available on paid plans.

Engine Yard.notes: To enable 2FA on Engine Yard, contact support.

Hostiso.notes: While both the main client area and the shared hosting panel support 2FA, each system is separate and requires its own setup.

HackerOne.notes: SMS-capable phone required for initial setup.

HootSuite.notes: Email is always enabled as backup method for Software Token.

Halebop.notes: 2FA is only available for Swedish citizens with BankID.

HelloSign.notes: SMS Two-factor authentication is only available to paid Business plan senders and above.

Klarna.notes: Software 2FA is only available for Swedish citizens with BankID.

Dashlane.notes: FIDO U2F is a Premium feature only.

Yandex.Disk.notes: SMS-capable phone required for initial setup.

Dyn.notes: Currently only supported for the Managed DNS & Email Delivery platforms (via DynID). Eventually DynID (and 2FA) will be rolled out to all platforms (no ETA).

Domeneshop.notes: SMS available only to customers in Norway, Sweden and Denmark.

Dropbox.notes: Hardware 2FA requires also enabling Software or SMS 2FA as a back-up.

Nordnet Sverige.notes: TFA only available for Swedish residents with BankID.

Square Enix.notes: Software implementation requires you to have purchased either Final Fantasy XI or Final Fantasy XIV and registered the game.

Coinify.notes: 2FA is only available for merchant accounts. myCoinify trading accounts do not support 2FA.

California Institute of Technology (CalT.notes: SMS-capable phone required for initial setup.

Commercial Bank of Qatar.notes: An SMS capable phone with a Qatar phone number is required.

Con Edison.notes: Requires phone number to set up. Can be bypassed by customer support.

1Password.notes: Teams using Duo with 1Password can't enable additional 2FA as it's already handled by Duo. Hardware tokens (not U2F) are only available through Duo.

UpCloud.notes: SMS is required for password recovery.

united-domains.de.notes: A phone number is required to enable two-factor authentication.

Medium.notes: Medium doesn't use passwords, instead emails a link to user to login

Yandex.Mail.notes: SMS-capable phone required for initial setup.

Bill.notes: 2FA via phone call is available for US and CA only.

BTC Markets.notes: A mobile phone number is required to reset two-factor authentication.

Bethesda.notes: SMS requires TOTP to be set up

Booking.com.notes: Setup requires SMS verification. Email is available via 'other options' at login.

bitwarden.notes: Premium account required for Duo, YubiKey and FIDO U2F.

Backupify.notes: A mobile phone is required for 2FA set-up.

BitMEX.notes: At most one 2FA method can be enabled at any time.

Nintendo Account.notes: 2FA not available for child accounts (users 12 years of age or younger) or supervised accounts (users 13 years of age or older attached to a parent account).

Arlo.notes: Email 2FA is always available as a backup.

Airship.notes: 2FA is only available upon request for customers on their Essential and Comprehensive plans.

Aruba Cloud.notes: Only the control panel supports 2FA (the main client area does not).

Airtable.notes: SMS must be enabled first and software 2FA can be bypassed by SMS.

Ancestry.notes: 2FA is currently only available for customers with a U.S. based phone number.

Airbnb.notes: Airbnb decides when 2FA is required; user cannot enable 2FA for every login.

AFIP.notes: 2FA is only available for users with security level (Clave Fiscal) 4

Amazon.notes: SMS or phone call required to enable 2FA. Enabling on Amazon.com activates 2FA on other regional Amazon sites, such as UK and DE.

GitHub.notes: Hardware tokens must have a backup method, either SMS or software token.

GoFundMe.notes: 2FA only for North American customers that create Personal campaigns.

Garena Online.notes: A mobile phone is required for 2FA.

GoDaddy.notes: If hardware 2FA enabled, customer support by phone requires enabling back-up method.

Remote Desktop Manager.notes: 2FA is only available on the Enterprise Edition

Repairshopr.notes: SMS only available as a backup to Google Authenticator.

ImmobilienScout24.notes: SMS is only available to commercial real estate providers.

Immowelt.notes: 2FA is only available for commercial partners.

Interactive Brokers.notes: SMS 2FA only works as long as no other method has been enabled.

Indeed.notes: 2FA is only available for employees and not for job seekers.

WageWorks.notes: Employer/plan sponsor may opt to not offer 2FA.

Wikipedia.notes: Currently limited to administrators (and users with admin-like permissions like interface editors), bureaucrats, checkusers, oversighters, stewards, edit filter managers and the OATH-testers global group.

Wyze.notes: 2FA via SMS is only available for USA and Canada.

Western Union.notes: 2FA is only available for business accounts.

LogMeIn.notes: SMS or email must be set up as a backup method

Loopia.notes: TFA only available for Swedish residents with BankID.

LastPass.notes: Availability of 2FA options depends on your account type.

Volksbanken Raiffeisenbanken.notes: Support for 2FA types depends on regional V&R banks.

US Veteran Affairs.notes: 2FA is only available when using the Identity Management service ID.me

Vanguard.notes: Hardware based 2FA requires SMS / Phone call 2FA as a backup. Hardware 2FA only works with the following hardware keys: Yubikey 4 Series, YubiKey 5 Series, Yubikey Security Key Series.

Vultr.notes: Hardware 2FA only supports YubiKeys with Yubico OTP credentials.

Zoho Mail.notes: YubiKey registration works only on the new version of Zoho Accounts. Only one (1) YubiKey may be registered at a time. Supported Devices: YubiKey NEO, YubiKey 4 Nano, YubiKey 4, YubiKey 4C, YubiKey 4C Nano, YubiKey NEO-n, YubiKey Edge, YubiKey Edge-n.

Zimbra.notes: Available in Zimbra Collaboration 8.7 and above, Network Edition only

join.me (w/ LogMeIn account).notes: SMS or email must be set up as a backup method

JetBrains.notes: U2F only available for Hub account (e.g. YouTrack). Limited to one software token OR one hardware token.

Tutanota.notes: Hardware 2FA not yet supported for their desktop & mobile apps.

Twitter.notes: Mobile apps do not support Hardware 2FA. Hardware 2FA requires enabling back-up method. Cannot add multiple security keys. SMS only available on select providers.

T-Mobile.notes: Backup methods of SMS or recovery questions can't be disabled.

Tresorit.notes: Requires enabling at least two 2FA methods.

Microsoft To-Do.notes: 2FA phone calls may not be available in all regions

Twitch.notes: To activate two factor authentication, you must provide a mobile phone number.

TurboSquid.notes: 2FA is only available with a verified email address

TransIP.notes: While both the main control panel and STACK support 2FA, each system is separate and requires its own setup.

Telia (Sweden).notes: 2FA is only available for Swedish citizens with BankID.

Intuit TurboTax.notes: Software 2FA requires enabling SMS or phone call as a back-up.

Square.notes: SMS only supported in US and Canada

Skype.notes: Must be associated with a Microsoft Account.

Skrill.notes: Email method requires an additional PIN

SecureSafe.notes: 2FA is only available on paid plans.

Amazon Pay.notes: SMS or phone call required to enable 2FA. Enabling on Amazon.com activates 2FA on other regional Amazon sites, such as UK and DE.

PAYEER.notes: Receiving codes via SMS cost 0.05$ each message. 2FA is personalizable in account settings.

Pivotal Tracker.notes: 2FA only works on the web version. If enabled, you will not be able to use the mobile apps.

PayPal.notes: 2FA is only available in a few countries. Contact PayPal on Twitter for an up-to-date list of available countries.

Xbox Live.notes: 2FA phone calls may not be available in all regions

Comcast.notes: Email 2FA requires the use of a non-Comcast.net email address.
